title: Minimal Reliance on Fossil Fuels for Electricity
description: In 2021, only 0.0004% of Nepal's electricity production came from oil, gas, and coal sources, highlighting a significant reliance on renewable energy.

title: Negligible CO2 Emissions from Energy Fugitive Sources
description: Nepal's CO2 emissions from fugitive energy sources were recorded at a mere 0.0001 Mt CO2e in 2023, indicating minimal environmental impact from this sector.

title: Low CO2 Emissions from Power Industry
description: In 2018, Nepal's power industry contributed only 0.0001 Mt CO2e to carbon emissions, showcasing its low carbon footprint in energy production.

title: Strong Financial Sector Rating
description: Nepal achieved a financial sector rating of 4 out of 6 in 2023, reflecting a robust and stable financial environment.

title: Minimal New Displacements Due to Conflict
description: In 2017, Nepal reported only 2 new cases of displacement associated with conflict and violence, indicating a relatively peaceful domestic environment.

title: High Dependence on Service Imports
description: In 2023, communications, computer, and other services accounted for 0.99% of Nepal's service imports, suggesting a reliance on foreign service providers.

title: Limited Commercial Service Imports
description: Computer, communications, and other services made up only 0.10% of Nepal's commercial service imports in 2023, indicating a potential area for growth in service trade.
